Claim: Students in America have to repeat the same grade next year.
Explaination: Stories about students having to repeat their grade originated on hoax sites.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Students in America have to repeat the same grade next year.

Explanation:Stories about students having to repeat their grade originated on hoax sites.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/31/facebook-posts/dont-fall-these-hoaxes-about-students-having-repea/

Claim: In South Florida “all children and adults must remain in their homes” due to coronavirus.
Explaination: We looked at announcements from several major local governments in south Florida and found no complete lockdown announcements. Gov. Ron DeSantis closed bars and nightclubs statewide.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: In South Florida “all children and adults must remain in their homes” due to coronavirus.

Explanation:We looked at announcements from several major local governments in south Florida and found no complete lockdown announcements. Gov. Ron DeSantis closed bars and nightclubs statewide.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/17/facebook-posts/fact-checking-false-claim-about-lockdowns-south-fl/

Claim: Xi Jinping visits a mosque for coronavirus.
Explaination: BOOM found that the video is from July 2016.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Xi Jinping visits a mosque for coronavirus.

Explanation:BOOM found that the video is from July 2016.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/old-photos-of-xi-jinpings-mosque-visit-falsely-linked-to-coronavirus-6803

Claim: A purported notice issued by the Pakistan Red Crescent and Pakistan’s Health Department on COVID-19 isolation rules has been shared thousands of times on Facebook. The advisory claims that families of those killed while in isolation will not be able to hold funerals or burials for them
Explaination: The claim is false; the Pakistan Red Crescent denied issuing such a statement, and Pakistan’s health authority does allow funerals for those killed by the novel coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A purported notice issued by the Pakistan Red Crescent and Pakistan’s Health Department on COVID-19 isolation rules has been shared thousands of times on Facebook. The advisory claims that families of those killed while in isolation will not be able to hold funerals or burials for them

Explanation:The claim is false; the Pakistan Red Crescent denied issuing such a statement, and Pakistan’s health authority does allow funerals for those killed by the novel coronavirus.

https://factcheck.afp.com/hoax-circulates-online-funerals-covid-19-victims-are-banned-pakistan

Claim: Post says “being exposed to the sun for two hours” kills the 2019 coronavirus.
Explaination: There is no evidence that sun exposure kills the 2019 coronavirus. UNICEF has debunked a post that claims the organization said sunlight is effective against the virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Post says “being exposed to the sun for two hours” kills the 2019 coronavirus.

Explanation:There is no evidence that sun exposure kills the 2019 coronavirus. UNICEF has debunked a post that claims the organization said sunlight is effective against the virus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/11/facebook-posts/sun-exposure-does-not-kill-coronavirus/

Claim: A purported advisory has been shared repeatedly in multiple Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp posts that claims a disinfectant will be sprayed into the air overnight in India in an effort to kill the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The posts urge residents to remain indoors during the spraying.
Explaination: The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A purported advisory has been shared repeatedly in multiple Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp posts that claims a disinfectant will be sprayed into the air overnight in India in an effort to kill the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The posts urge residents to remain indoors during the spraying.

Explanation:The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.

https://factcheck.afp.com/indian-authorities-refute-fake-advisory-which-claimed-disinfectant-would-be-sprayed-across-india?check=2

Claim: The novel coronavirus is not a new virus.
Explaination: Many coronavirus strains have already been discovered, but new strains regularly emerge due to mutations. The particular coronavirus responsible for the outbreak originating in Wuhan, China, provisionally named 2019-nCoV, is a new strain that was identified by scientists after sequencing its genome.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The novel coronavirus is not a new virus.

Explanation:Many coronavirus strains have already been discovered, but new strains regularly emerge due to mutations. The particular coronavirus responsible for the outbreak originating in Wuhan, China, provisionally named 2019-nCoV, is a new strain that was identified by scientists after sequencing its genome.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/the-2019-coronavirus-outbreak-is-caused-by-a-novel-virus-past-mentions-of-coronaviruses-refer-to-different-strains/

Claim: A poem about people staying home was written by Kathleen O’Mara in 1869.
Explaination: Catherine O’Meara, a retired teacher and chaplain, published the poem on her blog on March 16, 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A poem about people staying home was written by Kathleen O’Mara in 1869.

Explanation:Catherine O’Meara, a retired teacher and chaplain, published the poem on her blog on March 16, 2020.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/08/facebook-posts/viral-poem-about-staying-home-was-written-2020-not/

Claim: ”America has been vaccinating cattle for coronavirus for years, yet the news tells you it’s new and going to kill you all, so go buy a mask.”
Explaination: The vaccine for cattle won’t help humans, and won't protect against this new form of coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: ”America has been vaccinating cattle for coronavirus for years, yet the news tells you it’s new and going to kill you all, so go buy a mask.”

Explanation:The vaccine for cattle won’t help humans, and won't protect against this new form of coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/02/facebook-posts/bovine-coronavirus-vaccine-wont-help-humans/
ann16_remarks: Also mentions Public authority - but the main point is about cattle vaccination

Claim: Autopsy reveals a Wuhan doctor was murdered in his sickbed.
Explaination: The story fabricates a quote and did not offer on-the-record source for its claim. It also came from a website that frequently publishes false information. Other news outlets confirmed Li Wenliang died from the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Autopsy reveals a Wuhan doctor was murdered in his sickbed.

Explanation:The story fabricates a quote and did not offer on-the-record source for its claim. It also came from a website that frequently publishes false information. Other news outlets confirmed Li Wenliang died from the coronavirus.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471628-autopsy-did-not-reveal-wuhan-doctor-was-murdered-in-sick-bed.html

Claim: Fill out a 2020 U.S. Census form to receive an economic stimulus payment.
Explaination: U.S. government relief payments for coronavirus relief will be determined by tax returns, not census information.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Fill out a 2020 U.S. Census form to receive an economic stimulus payment.

Explanation:U.S. government relief payments for coronavirus relief will be determined by tax returns, not census information.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/2020-census-not-tied-to-coronavirus-relief-payments/

Claim: A post has been shared multiple times on Facebook in March 2020 that claims China and Japan are “free” of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; data from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows new cases continue to be reported in both countries.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post has been shared multiple times on Facebook in March 2020 that claims China and Japan are “free” of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; data from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows new cases continue to be reported in both countries.

https://factcheck.afp.com/false-claim-circulates-online-china-and-japan-are-free-covid-19

Claim: Posts shared more than 20,000 times on Facebook feature a photo of a crying child and two others showing a woman and a man in hospital beds, claiming that the boy’s parents are infected with the novel coronavirus
Explaination: This is false, the pictures do not depict a family and circulated online prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Posts shared more than 20,000 times on Facebook feature a photo of a crying child and two others showing a woman and a man in hospital beds, claiming that the boy’s parents are infected with the novel coronavirus

Explanation:This is false, the pictures do not depict a family and circulated online prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photos-vaping-illness-patients-used-make-false-covid-19-claim

Claim: The spokesman for Chinese Foreign Ministry Zhao Lijian: American CDC admitted that COVID-19 patients were misdiagnosed as flu. U.S. Army is responsible for the outbreak in Wuhan.
Explaination: China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian tweeted and commanded.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The spokesman for Chinese Foreign Ministry Zhao Lijian: American CDC admitted that COVID-19 patients were misdiagnosed as flu. U.S. Army is responsible for the outbreak in Wuhan.

Explanation:China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian tweeted and commanded.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/3243

Claim: A graphic has been shared thousands of times on Facebook which claims that gargling warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A graphic has been shared thousands of times on Facebook which claims that gargling warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/gargling-warm-salt-water-or-vinegar-does-not-prevent-coronavirus-infection-health-experts-say

Claim: Coronavirus death toll in the U.S. is inflated by inclusion of unrelated deaths.
Explaination: Many experts believe the number of deaths linked to the novel coronavirus in the U.S. is likely higher than the figures available — due to factors such as an insufficient number of tests and inconsistent reporting across locales.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Coronavirus death toll in the U.S. is inflated by inclusion of unrelated deaths.

Explanation:Many experts believe the number of deaths linked to the novel coronavirus in the U.S. is likely higher than the figures available — due to factors such as an insufficient number of tests and inconsistent reporting across locales.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/04/social-media-posts-make-baseless-claim-on-covid-19-death-toll/

Claim: Girl infected with coronavirus found dead in her apartment in Delhi.
Explaination: Contrary to the claim, the incident in the post does not pertain to a coronavirus case in Delhi but is related to the death of a 22-year-old woman in Tamil Nadu’s Chettipedu.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Girl infected with coronavirus found dead in her apartment in Delhi.

Explanation:Contrary to the claim, the incident in the post does not pertain to a coronavirus case in Delhi but is related to the death of a 22-year-old woman in Tamil Nadu’s Chettipedu.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/death-in-tamil-nadu-shared-as-delhi-coronavirus-case-fact-check

Claim: “In ‘Resident Evil’ the Umbrella Corporation releases a virus that infects the people of Raccoon City. A biological research lab with the exact same logo as the Umbrella Corporation can be found in the city where the coronavirus outbreak originated.”
Explaination: There’s no evidence that the 2019 coronavirus that was first detected in Wuhan was created in a lab. It likely has its origins in bats, according to the CDC.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “In ‘Resident Evil’ the Umbrella Corporation releases a virus that infects the people of Raccoon City. A biological research lab with the exact same logo as the Umbrella Corporation can be found in the city where the coronavirus outbreak originated.”

Explanation:There’s no evidence that the 2019 coronavirus that was first detected in Wuhan was created in a lab. It likely has its origins in bats, according to the CDC.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/03/facebook-posts/viral-image-draws-misleading-parallel-between-coro/

Claim: CDC issued facial hair recommendation for novel coronavirus prevention.
Explaination: Graphic is more than two years old and is unrelated to current outbreak.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: CDC issued facial hair recommendation for novel coronavirus prevention.

Explanation:Graphic is more than two years old and is unrelated to current outbreak.

https://factcheck.afp.com/us-disease-experts-did-not-issue-novel-coronavirus-related-facial-hair-guide
ann16_remarks: Assuming CDC falls under same category as WHO

Claim: Keeping your throat moist will wash the coronavirus down to your stomach where the virus will die.
Explaination: Both the World Health Organization (WHO) and doctor Norberto Francisco, chief of clinical trials and research at the Lung Center of the Philippines, say that drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Keeping your throat moist will wash the coronavirus down to your stomach where the virus will die.

Explanation:Both the World Health Organization (WHO) and doctor Norberto Francisco, chief of clinical trials and research at the Lung Center of the Philippines, say that drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256359-drinking-water-washes-coronavirus-stomach-prevents-entering-lungs

Claim: The NBA is asking President Donald Trump to “resign or we’ll never play again.”
Explaination: There is no evidence NBA players voted to suspend games until Trump was removed from office. The fake news story was copied from a website that claims to be satirical.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: The NBA is asking President Donald Trump to “resign or we’ll never play again.”

Explanation:There is no evidence NBA players voted to suspend games until Trump was removed from office. The fake news story was copied from a website that claims to be satirical.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/06/blog-posting/fake-news-website-republishes-satirical-story-abou/

Claim: Scientists from Australia create the first vaccine for novel coronavirus
Explaination: This website was a scam. There is no known, widely available or public vaccine for the coronavirus. The website that was taking orders was shut down.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Scientists from Australia create the first vaccine for novel coronavirus

Explanation:This website was a scam. There is no known, widely available or public vaccine for the coronavirus. The website that was taking orders was shut down.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471589-fake-news-scientists-from-australia-did-not-create-first-vaccine-for-novel-coronavirus.html

Claim: Photo of Iranian officials visiting the vice president after she contracted COVID-19.
Explaination: The photo has circulated in reports since 2014, after one of Iran's vice-presidents was injured in a traffic accident.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo of Iranian officials visiting the vice president after she contracted COVID-19.

Explanation:The photo has circulated in reports since 2014, after one of Iran's vice-presidents was injured in a traffic accident.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-has-circulated-reports-2014-after-one-irans-vice-presidents-was-injured-traffic-accident

Claim: A video shows a fortune teller predicting the coronavirus pandemic in December on Spanish TV.
Explaination: There is no evidence that the video was recorded in December, it only appears on the internet in February 2020. In the last video that the fortune teller recorded in December, she says that the year 2020 will be the beginning of a positive cycle.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A video shows a fortune teller predicting the coronavirus pandemic in December on Spanish TV.

Explanation:There is no evidence that the video was recorded in December, it only appears on the internet in February 2020. In the last video that the fortune teller recorded in December, she says that the year 2020 will be the beginning of a positive cycle.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-uma-vidente-previu-a-pandemia-da-covid-19-na-televisao-espanhola-em-dezembro/

Claim: A claim has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter that an emergency decree issued in Thailand due to the novel coronavirus pandemic included a strict curfew.
Explaination: The claim is false; the emergency decree declared on March 25, 2020 by Thailand’s prime minister did not include a curfew.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter that an emergency decree issued in Thailand due to the novel coronavirus pandemic included a strict curfew.

Explanation:The claim is false; the emergency decree declared on March 25, 2020 by Thailand’s prime minister did not include a curfew.

https://factcheck.afp.com/thailands-emergency-decree-combat-covid-19-does-not-include-any-curfew
